body_html:
Hi, @Amir-Arsalan

you may need to use cmake with
-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE
-DPYTHON_LIBRARY
-DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR

for example , use the following cmd:

cmake .. -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=/usr/bin/python3.5m \
-DPYTHON_LIBRARY=/usr/lib/python3.5/config-3.5m-x86_64-linux-gnu/libpython3.5m.so \
-DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR=/usr/include/python3.5m
body_text:
Hi, @Amir-Arsalan
you may need to use cmake with
-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE
-DPYTHON_LIBRARY
-DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR
for example , use the following cmd:
cmake .. -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=/usr/bin/python3.5m \
-DPYTHON_LIBRARY=/usr/lib/python3.5/config-3.5m-x86_64-linux-gnu/libpython3.5m.so \
-DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR=/usr/include/python3.5m
body:
Hi, @Amir-Arsalan

you may need to use cmake with
``-DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE``
``-DPYTHON_LIBRARY``
``-DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR``

for example , use the following cmd:

```
cmake .. -DPYTHON_EXECUTABLE=/usr/bin/python3.5m \
-DPYTHON_LIBRARY=/usr/lib/python3.5/config-3.5m-x86_64-linux-gnu/libpython3.5m.so \
-DPYTHON_INCLUDE_DIR=/usr/include/python3.5m
```
